answers.answer: Drink milk it will help a lil. I get it too and it *****.
Yes I suffer. Tums are ur friend! Try to eat smaller portions and drink water, however, none of that works for me I just deal. Its a pregnant thing for real!

Avoid spicy foods and very acidic foods as they tend to aggravate it... cut down sugars as much as possible since that also aggravates it... drink more water, dont eat too close to bed time and eat smaller portions and healthy snacks throughout the day.... I have acidic reflux really bad and my doctor gave me zantac for it... but when I had to change my diet for gestational diabetes it got better because all my sugary stuff that I love I had to cut out of my diet-- like my sodas
Any dairy products help me, I especially like milk and ice cream and it gives me a reason to eat ice cream at 5am and not be judged by my husband lol

I've had it bad with all three pregnancies.  Avoid eating close to bedtime, always keep Tums around, and drink milk like it's your job.  I've tried monitoring my diet to avoid certain foods, but that's never worked for me.  Try to only eat small meals too.
Thanks everyone! Loving milk at the moment, so I'm happy to hear it can help.

question: Does anyone else suffer from reflux/indigestion?I'm 28 weeks and its just started today. Everytime I eat, even if its a small amount, I end up getting a burning, gasey uncomfortable feeling in my chest. I haven't had it before but I'm pretty sure its reflux..Any advice on how I can settle it? Any food I should be avoiding?Thanks!
title: Reflux! Help!!
